back_cards.definition_en: The direction toward the lower part of a map, opposite north
back_cards.example_en: We drove south to visit the beach for the weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: A region or area located in the southern part of a country
back_cards.example_en: The south of the state is known for its warm climate.

back_cards.definition_en: A cardinal direction used in navigation
back_cards.example_en: The compass pointed south as we hiked through the forest.

back_cards.definition_en: A cultural or historical region, often associated with specific traditions
back_cards.example_en: The south is famous for its hospitality and soul food.

back_cards.definition_en: A wind coming from the southern direction
back_cards.example_en: A warm south wind brought relief after the cold spell.

back_cards.definition_en: Toward the front or ahead in direction
back_cards.example_en: She stepped forward to greet the guests at the door.

back_cards.definition_en: Progressing or moving toward a goal
back_cards.example_en: The team moved forward with the new project plan.
We look forward to celebrating the holidays together.

back_cards.definition_en: In a bold or confident manner
back_cards.example_en: He spoke forward during the meeting, sharing his ideas.

back_cards.definition_en: To send or pass something on to another person
back_cards.example_en: Please forward the email to the entire department.

back_cards.definition_en: A topic or theme of discussion or study
back_cards.example_en: The subject of the lecture was climate change.

back_cards.definition_en: A person or thing being discussed or described
back_cards.example_en: The subject of the painting was a serene lake.

back_cards.definition_en: A branch of knowledge studied in school
back_cards.example_en: Math is her favorite subject in high school.

back_cards.definition_en: A person under the authority of another
back_cards.example_en: The king’s subjects gathered to hear his speech.

back_cards.definition_en: The main focus of a sentence in grammar
back_cards.example_en: In the sentence, ‘The cat sleeps,’ the cat is the subject.
She sought financial advice to plan her retirement.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to the management of funds
back_cards.example_en: The company faced financial challenges after the merger.
He reviewed the financial report before the meeting.
They created a financial plan to save for a house.
The financial sector thrived during the economic boom.

back_cards.definition_en: To recognize or name something or someone
back_cards.example_en: She could identify the bird by its colorful feathers.

back_cards.definition_en: To establish the identity of a person
back_cards.example_en: The police used fingerprints to identify the suspect.

back_cards.definition_en: To relate to or feel a connection with
back_cards.example_en: He could identify with the struggles of new parents.
The teacher asked students to identify the main idea.
You need to identify yourself to access the secure area.

back_cards.definition_en: Pleasing to the senses, especially visually
back_cards.example_en: The sunset over the mountains was absolutely beautiful.

back_cards.definition_en: Having an attractive quality or charm
back_cards.example_en: She wore a beautiful dress to the wedding.
The artist created a beautiful painting of the forest.
Her kind words were a beautiful gesture of support.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing a perfect or ideal situation
back_cards.example_en: It was a beautiful day for a picnic in the park.
She’s been working at the company for over a decade.

back_cards.definition_en: A time period marked by specific events
back_cards.example_en: The 1960s was a decade of social change.

back_cards.definition_en: A unit of time in historical contexts
back_cards.example_en: The museum showcased artifacts from the last decade.

back_cards.definition_en: A phase of personal or professional life
back_cards.example_en: In her third decade, she started a new career.

back_cards.definition_en: A term used to group years culturally
back_cards.example_en: The 80s decade is known for its vibrant music.

back_cards.definition_en: A small piece or amount of something
back_cards.example_en: She ate a bit of chocolate after lunch.
I’ll be there in a bit, just finishing up.

back_cards.definition_en: A part or component of something larger
back_cards.example_en: The drill bit broke while working on the project.

back_cards.definition_en: A unit of information in computing
back_cards.example_en: This processor handles 64-bit data efficiently.

back_cards.definition_en: A small role or minor action
back_cards.example_en: He did his bit to help clean the park.

back_cards.definition_en: To make something smaller in size or amount
back_cards.example_en: They decided to reduce the budget for the event.

back_cards.definition_en: To decrease the intensity or severity
back_cards.example_en: Regular exercise can reduce stress levels.

back_cards.definition_en: To simplify or make more efficient
back_cards.example_en: The chef showed how to reduce a sauce for flavor.

back_cards.definition_en: To lower in rank or status
back_cards.example_en: He was reduced to a lower position after the error.

back_cards.definition_en: To cut back on usage or consumption
back_cards.example_en: We need to reduce our use of plastic bags.
My sister and I share a room at home.

back_cards.definition_en: A close female friend or companion
back_cards.example_en: She’s like a sister to me after years of friendship.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of a religious or community group
back_cards.example_en: The sister at the convent helped the orphans.

back_cards.definition_en: A term of affection in informal settings
back_cards.example_en: Hey, sister, want to grab coffee later?

back_cards.definition_en: A counterpart in a related organization
back_cards.example_en: Our school has a sister campus in another city.

back_cards.definition_en: The standard or degree of excellence
back_cards.example_en: The quality of this fabric is exceptional.
Her best quality is her endless patience.
They sell quality furniture at affordable prices.
The quality of the service at the hotel was outstanding.
The factory ensures the quality of every item.

back_cards.definition_en: At a fast speed or pace
back_cards.example_en: She ran quickly to catch the bus.

back_cards.definition_en: In a short amount of time
back_cards.example_en: He finished the task quickly before lunch.
The team responded quickly to the emergency.

back_cards.definition_en: In a swift or hurried manner
back_cards.example_en: She quickly packed her bag for the trip.
He quickly grasped the new concept in class.

back_cards.definition_en: To take action or do something
back_cards.example_en: We must act now to save the environment.

back_cards.definition_en: To perform in a play or film
back_cards.example_en: She loves to act in the school theater productions.

back_cards.definition_en: To behave in a certain way
back_cards.example_en: He acted bravely during the crisis.

back_cards.definition_en: To function or serve a purpose
back_cards.example_en: This pill acts as a pain reliever.

back_cards.definition_en: To represent or stand in for someone
back_cards.example_en: She will act as the team leader today.

back_cards.definition_en: To push or apply pressure to something
back_cards.example_en: Press the button to start the machine.

back_cards.definition_en: To urge or push someone to act
back_cards.example_en: They pressed her to join the committee.

back_cards.definition_en: To iron or smooth out clothes
back_cards.example_en: He pressed his shirt before the interview.

back_cards.definition_en: To publish or report in media
back_cards.example_en: The newspaper pressed the story on the front page.
Fans pressed against the gates to see the star.
She tends to worry about her exams.

back_cards.definition_en: To think about problems or fears
back_cards.example_en: He worried about the cost of repairs.
Don’t let the noise worry you; it’s temporary.
The news worried the entire community.
She worried over which dress to wear.

back_cards.definition_en: To agree to receive or take something
back_cards.example_en: She accepted the gift with a smile.
He accepted her explanation about the delay.
The school accepted her application.
They learned to accept the cold winters.

back_cards.definition_en: To agree to terms or conditions
back_cards.example_en: He accepted the job offer immediately.

back_cards.definition_en: To go or come into a place
back_cards.example_en: She entered the room quietly.

back_cards.definition_en: To join or participate in something
back_cards.example_en: He entered the competition with confidence.
Please enter your name in the form.
They entered a new phase of their project.
She entered her child in the local school.

back_cards.definition_en: To briefly refer to or speak about
back_cards.example_en: She mentioned her trip during the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: To note or bring up in conversation
back_cards.example_en: He mentioned that he saw a good movie.
The teacher mentioned Einstein’s theory.
They mentioned her in the credits.
He mentioned a possible change in plans.

back_cards.definition_en: Something heard, like a noise or tone
back_cards.example_en: The sound of rain relaxed her.
The sound of the bell signaled lunch.

back_cards.definition_en: The quality of audio in media
back_cards.example_en: The movie’s sound was crystal clear.

back_cards.definition_en: A body of water, like a strait
back_cards.example_en: The ship sailed through the sound.
His words had the sound of confidence.
She studied hard, thus passing the exam.
He organized the files thus to save time.
The project was thus far successful.
The evidence was clear, thus the case closed.
Many animals, thus the lion, are predators.

back_cards.definition_en: A living organism that grows in soil
back_cards.example_en: She watered the plant on her windowsill.
The car plant employs thousands of workers.

back_cards.definition_en: A deliberately placed object or person
back_cards.example_en: The spy was a plant in the organization.

back_cards.definition_en: A type of vegetation in nature
back_cards.example_en: This plant thrives in tropical climates.
The power plant supplies the city’s energy.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of moving or changing position
back_cards.example_en: The movement of the dancers was graceful.

back_cards.definition_en: A group effort for social or political change
back_cards.example_en: She joined the environmental movement.

back_cards.definition_en: A trend or shift in opinion
back_cards.example_en: There’s a movement toward healthier eating.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a musical composition
back_cards.example_en: The symphony’s second movement was slow.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of progressing or advancing
back_cards.example_en: The movement of the project was on track.

back_cards.definition_en: A setting or location of an event
back_cards.example_en: The crime scene was carefully examined.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a play, movie, or story
back_cards.example_en: The final scene of the film was emotional.
The mountain scene was breathtaking.
She’s active in the local art scene.
He caused a scene at the restaurant.

back_cards.definition_en: A part or division of something
back_cards.example_en: Read the first section of the book.

back_cards.definition_en: A distinct area within a larger space
back_cards.example_en: The store’s electronics section is upstairs.

back_cards.definition_en: A segment of a population or group
back_cards.example_en: This section of voters supports the policy.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a document or law
back_cards.example_en: Section 3 outlines the new regulations.

back_cards.definition_en: A cut or slice in technical contexts
back_cards.example_en: The geologist studied a rock section.

back_cards.definition_en: Medical care for an illness or injury
back_cards.example_en: She received treatment for her broken arm.

back_cards.definition_en: The way someone is dealt with
back_cards.example_en: The staff gave her special treatment.

back_cards.definition_en: A method to improve or process something
back_cards.example_en: The water treatment plant is efficient.

back_cards.definition_en: A discussion or handling of a topic
back_cards.example_en: The book’s treatment of history is detailed.
His skin treatment took several weeks.
I wish I could travel to Europe.

back_cards.definition_en: To express hope for someone’s well-being
back_cards.example_en: She wished him luck on his exam.
He wished for a simpler life.
I wish you’d call before visiting.

back_cards.definition_en: To hope for a specific outcome
back_cards.example_en: They wished for rain to end the drought.
Exercise has many health benefits.
She receives benefits from her employer.
The new policy brought benefits to all.

back_cards.definition_en: A public event for a cause
back_cards.example_en: The concert was a benefit for charity.
The app’s main benefit is its simplicity.
The book was so interesting I couldn’t stop reading.
Her lecture on space was very interesting.
The museum had an interesting collection.
He shared an interesting fact about whales.
She’s an interesting person to talk to.

back_cards.definition_en: The direction toward the setting sun
back_cards.example_en: The sun sets in the west every evening.

back_cards.definition_en: A region in the western part of a country
back_cards.example_en: The west is known for its rugged landscapes.
We traveled west to reach the coast.
The wild west is famous in American history.

back_cards.definition_en: A wind coming from the west
back_cards.example_en: A cool west breeze swept through the valley.

back_cards.definition_en: A person running for a position
back_cards.example_en: She’s a candidate for mayor in the election.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone being considered for a role
back_cards.example_en: He’s a strong candidate for the job.

back_cards.definition_en: A person nominated for an award
back_cards.example_en: The film was a candidate for best picture.
This city is a candidate for the new office.

back_cards.definition_en: A student applying for a program
back_cards.example_en: The candidate aced the university entrance exam.

back_cards.definition_en: To come near or closer to
back_cards.example_en: We approached the city as the sun set.

back_cards.definition_en: To deal with or handle something
back_cards.example_en: She approached the problem with confidence.
He approached the manager with a proposal.

back_cards.definition_en: To begin working on a task
back_cards.example_en: They approached the project with enthusiasm.

back_cards.definition_en: To suggest or offer an idea
back_cards.example_en: She approached him about joining the team.
The judge will determine the case’s outcome.

back_cards.definition_en: To find out or establish facts
back_cards.example_en: Scientists determined the age of the fossil.
Her skills determined her success in the role.

back_cards.definition_en: To resolve or make a firm decision
back_cards.example_en: He determined to finish the race no matter what.
The rules determine how the game is played.

back_cards.definition_en: A supply of materials or assets
back_cards.example_en: The forest is a valuable natural resource.

back_cards.definition_en: A source of help or information
back_cards.example_en: The library is a great resource for students.

back_cards.definition_en: Money or funding for a project
back_cards.example_en: The company allocated resources for research.
Her creativity is her greatest resource.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool or means to achieve something
back_cards.example_en: Online courses are a resource for learning.
She claimed she saw the accident happen.
He claimed his prize after winning the contest.
They claimed the land as their own.
The storm claimed many trees in the park.
She claimed insurance for the damaged car.
His answer to the quiz was correct.
The answer to the puzzle was simple.
She gave a quick answer during the debate.
Laughter was his answer to the joke.
The answer to her email came promptly.
She worked hard to prove her theory.
He proved himself as a reliable worker.
The data proved the experiment’s success.
The decision proved to be a mistake.
They proved the software before release.
She sorted the books by author.
They sorted the files into folders.
He sorted the issue with the computer.

back_cards.definition_en: To separate by type or quality
back_cards.example_en: The machine sorts apples by size.
She sorted her schedule for the week.
We have enough food for the party.
She studied enough to pass the test.

back_cards.definition_en: As much as needed or required
back_cards.example_en: He saved enough to buy a car.
I’ve had enough of this noise!
The room was big enough for the meeting.
The size of the box was too large.

back_cards.definition_en: The extent or scale of something
back_cards.example_en: The size of the crowd surprised her.

back_cards.definition_en: A measurement for clothing or shoes
back_cards.example_en: She wears a size 8 dress.

back_cards.definition_en: The magnitude of an event or issue
back_cards.example_en: The size of the problem grew quickly.
They offer cups in three sizes.
Somebody left their jacket here.
She’s somebody in the fashion industry.

back_cards.definition_en: An individual in a general sense
back_cards.example_en: Somebody needs to clean the kitchen.
I saw somebody at the park earlier.
We need somebody to lead the project.
Her knowledge of history is impressive.
He had no knowledge of the plan.
The professor shared his knowledge with students.
Traveling expands your knowledge of cultures.
She has knowledge of coding languages.

back_cards.definition_en: To a certain extent or degree
back_cards.example_en: The movie was rather boring at first.
I’d rather stay home than go out.
It’s a challenge, or rather, an opportunity.
She’d rather walk than drive to work.
The hike was rather tiring but fun.
She hung the picture on the wall.
We love to hang out at the park.
The lights hung beautifully over the street.
The smell of paint hung in the air.
In old stories, pirates were hung.
Soccer is her favorite sport to play.
The school hosts a sport tournament yearly.

back_cards.definition_en: A source of amusement or fun
back_cards.example_en: Fishing is a sport for many locals.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who behaves well in defeat
back_cards.example_en: He was a good sport after losing.
They made a sport of guessing the score.
We bought a new TV for the living room.
She works in TV as a producer.

back_cards.definition_en: A source of entertainment at home
back_cards.example_en: The kids watch TV after homework.
That TV show is popular worldwide.
TV has changed with streaming services.
The loss of her keys upset her.
The team suffered a loss in the finals.
The loss of her friend was heartbreaking.

back_cards.definition_en: A reduction in value or amount
back_cards.example_en: The company reported a financial loss.
He felt a deep loss after moving away.

back_cards.definition_en: To present reasons for or against
back_cards.example_en: They argued about the new policy.
The siblings often argue over chores.

back_cards.definition_en: To make a case or point
back_cards.example_en: She argued that recycling saves resources.
The lawyers argued the case in court.
He argued his friend into joining the club.

back_cards.definition_en: Located on the side opposite right
back_cards.example_en: Turn at the left corner of the street.
There’s some left pizza in the fridge.
She supports left policies on healthcare.
The left building has been empty for years.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to the left hand or side
back_cards.example_en: He writes with his left hand.
She took a note during the lecture.
He left a note on the fridge.
The song ended on a high note.
Her speech included a note of caution.
He paid with a ten-dollar note.

back_cards.definition_en: A gathering of people for discussion
back_cards.example_en: The team had a meeting about the project.
Their meeting at the café was brief.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal assembly for a purpose
back_cards.example_en: The annual meeting attracted many shareholders.
She scheduled a meeting with the client.

back_cards.definition_en: A convergence of ideas or goals
back_cards.example_en: The meeting of minds led to a solution.

back_cards.definition_en: An ability to do something well
back_cards.example_en: Her cooking skill impressed everyone.
He developed his skill in photography.
Her skill in coding got her the job.
Woodworking is a skill he enjoys.
The job requires strong communication skills.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of paper for information
back_cards.example_en: She sent a birthday card to her friend.

back_cards.definition_en: A playing piece in a game
back_cards.example_en: He drew an ace from the card deck.
I paid with my card at the store.
She showed her ID card at the gate.
The main event is the card for tonight.
She had a feeling of joy at the news.
The cold gave her a numb feeling.
My feeling is that we should wait.
The room had a cozy feeling.
He had a feeling something was wrong.

back_cards.definition_en: In spite of or regardless of
back_cards.example_en: She went jogging despite the rain.
He succeeded despite many obstacles.
They laughed despite the sad news.
Despite his fear, he gave the speech.
She traveled alone despite the warnings.

back_cards.definition_en: A unit of measurement for angles
back_cards.example_en: The angle measures 90 degrees.
She earned a degree in biology.

back_cards.definition_en: A level of intensity or extent
back_cards.example_en: The storm caused a degree of damage.
It’s 75 degrees outside today.

back_cards.definition_en: A stage or level in a process
back_cards.example_en: They reached a degree of agreement.

back_cards.definition_en: An illegal act punishable by law
back_cards.example_en: The police investigated the crime.
Stealing is considered a crime.
Littering is a crime in some areas.
Cyber crime is on the rise.
It’s a crime to waste such talent.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to a specific thing or person
back_cards.example_en: That is the book I was talking about.
She said that she was tired.
Look at that bird in the tree.
That was the best movie ever.
I heard that you got a new job.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol or gesture with meaning
back_cards.example_en: The stop sign was clear at the corner.
Dark clouds are a sign of rain.
The sign said ‘No Parking’.
She used a sign to say ‘hello’.

back_cards.definition_en: A trace or hint of something
back_cards.example_en: There was no sign of the missing cat.
The accident occurred at midnight.

back_cards.definition_en: To come to mind or be thought of
back_cards.example_en: It didn’t occur to me to call.
These plants occur in tropical regions.

back_cards.definition_en: To take place as an event
back_cards.example_en: The festival occurs every summer.

back_cards.definition_en: To arise or come up unexpectedly
back_cards.example_en: A problem occurred during the test.

back_cards.definition_en: To form a mental image or idea
back_cards.example_en: Imagine a world without pollution.
I can’t imagine why she left.
She imagined a new design for the room.
He imagined becoming a famous singer.
I imagine they’ll arrive soon.
Her vote helped elect the new mayor.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of choosing in an election
back_cards.example_en: The vote takes place tomorrow.
The committee’s vote was unanimous.

back_cards.definition_en: A right to participate in electing
back_cards.example_en: Every citizen has a vote.
His vote was for the new policy.
The park is near my house.
The holiday is near, so we’re preparing.
The project is near completion.
Her skills are near professional level.
There’s a café near the station.

back_cards.definition_en: A male ruler of a country
back_cards.example_en: The king ruled for 40 years.

back_cards.definition_en: A person or thing supreme in its field
back_cards.example_en: He’s the king of chess in our club.
She played the king of hearts.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece in the game of chess
back_cards.example_en: Protecting the king is key in chess.

back_cards.definition_en: A title for a celebrated figure
back_cards.example_en: Elvis is known as the king of rock.
She packed her books in a box.
They sat in a box at the theater.

back_cards.definition_en: A section or area on a form
back_cards.example_en: Check the box to agree to the terms.
The phone came in a sturdy box.
The goalie stayed near the box.
The present situation requires action.
She was present at the meeting.
The present year has been challenging.
He was fully present during the talk.
All members were present for the vote.
The sales figure was impressive.
The statue had a graceful figure.
She’s a key figure in the company.
The fabric had a star figure pattern.
He gave a rough figure for the cost.
She has seven cats at home.

back_cards.definition_en: A group or set of seven
back_cards.example_en: The team consists of seven players.

back_cards.definition_en: A time associated with the number
back_cards.example_en: We meet at seven in the evening.

back_cards.definition_en: A card or value in games
back_cards.example_en: He played a seven in the card game.
Seven is considered a lucky number.
She loves trying foreign foods.
The concept was foreign to him.
He works in foreign policy.
A foreign species was found in the lake.
Foreign objects were removed from the machine.
She laughed at the funny joke.
He laughed when the dog chased its tail.

back_cards.definition_en: To chuckle in a social setting
back_cards.example_en: They laughed together at the party.
She laughed off the silly rumor.
He laughed with relief after the test.
The disease spread quickly in the area.
Heart disease is a major health concern.
The crop was damaged by a disease.
Corruption is a disease in the system.
She’s researching a cure for the disease.

back_cards.definition_en: A polite term for a woman
back_cards.example_en: The lady at the counter was helpful.

back_cards.definition_en: A woman of refinement or status
back_cards.example_en: She’s a true lady with great manners.
The lady of the manor hosted a ball.

back_cards.definition_en: A term of respect or affection
back_cards.example_en: Excuse me, lady, you dropped your scarf.

back_cards.definition_en: A woman in a specific role
back_cards.example_en: The cleaning lady comes every Tuesday.
The hills are beyond the river.
Her skills are beyond average.
The task is beyond my expertise.
The shop is open beyond 8 PM.
The beauty of the scene was beyond words.
We discussed the plan over coffee.

back_cards.definition_en: To consider or examine in detail
back_cards.example_en: The team discussed the new strategy.
They discussed the issue in class.
She discussed her goals with her mentor.
The panel will discuss the proposal tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: To complete a task or activity
back_cards.example_en: She finished her homework before dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: To reach the end of something
back_cards.example_en: They finished the race in first place.
He finished the pizza by himself.

back_cards.definition_en: To apply a final coat or layer
back_cards.example_en: The carpenter finished the table with varnish.
The meeting finished earlier than expected.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan or drawing for creation
back_cards.example_en: The architect shared the house design.

back_cards.definition_en: The style or appearance of something
back_cards.example_en: The car’s design is sleek and modern.
The fabric has a floral design.
Graphic design is her career choice.
The design of the study was innovative.

back_cards.definition_en: A feeling of worry or care
back_cards.example_en: Her concern for her friend was obvious.
Safety is a major concern in the city.

back_cards.definition_en: A matter of interest or importance
back_cards.example_en: The issue is of concern to voters.
The concern employs over 500 people.
He showed concern for the injured dog.

back_cards.definition_en: A spherical object used in games
back_cards.example_en: She kicked the ball across the field.
They attended the charity ball.
The cat played with a ball of yarn.
The pitcher threw a fast ball.
We had a ball at the party.

back_cards.definition_en: The direction of the rising sun
back_cards.example_en: The sun rises in the east every morning.

back_cards.definition_en: A region in the eastern part
back_cards.example_en: The east of the country is mountainous.
We headed east to reach the lake.
The east is known for its traditions.

back_cards.definition_en: A wind coming from the east
back_cards.example_en: An east wind brought cooler weather.
She recognized her old friend instantly.
The school recognized her achievements.
He recognized the need for change.
They recognized her for her hard work.

back_cards.definition_en: To identify by appearance or sound
back_cards.example_en: I recognized the song on the radio.

back_cards.definition_en: To submit a request or application
back_cards.example_en: She applied for the job online.

back_cards.definition_en: To put into use or action
back_cards.example_en: He applied the paint to the wall.
This rule doesn’t apply to you.

back_cards.definition_en: To use a skill or knowledge
back_cards.example_en: She applied her math skills to the problem.
Apply sunscreen before going outside.
She prepared dinner for her guests.

back_cards.definition_en: To plan or arrange in advance
back_cards.example_en: They prepared for the upcoming exam.

back_cards.definition_en: To train or equip for a task
back_cards.example_en: He prepared the team for the match.
The chef prepared a special sauce.

back_cards.definition_en: To get mentally or physically ready
back_cards.example_en: She prepared herself for the speech.
Her professional network helped her find a job.
The office network crashed yesterday.
The show airs on a major network.

back_cards.definition_en: A web of connections or systems
back_cards.example_en: The subway network covers the city.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of contacts for support
back_cards.example_en: He built a network of local businesses.

back_cards.definition_en: Very large in size or amount
back_cards.example_en: The elephant was huge compared to the car.
The project was a huge success.
She has a huge collection of books.
The news had a huge effect on the team.
There was a huge crowd at the concert.
Her hard work led to great success.
The surgery was a complete success.

back_cards.definition_en: A person or thing that succeeds
back_cards.example_en: The new product was a success.
He dreamed of success as an actor.

back_cards.definition_en: A positive result in any endeavor
back_cards.example_en: Teamwork ensured the event’s success.
The school is in the downtown district.
She represents the third district.

back_cards.definition_en: A geographic area with a purpose
back_cards.example_en: The shopping district is always busy.
The historic district attracts tourists.
The district voted for a new mayor.
She sipped coffee from her cup.
Add one cup of flour to the recipe.
The team won the championship cup.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a golf course
back_cards.example_en: The ball rolled close to the cup.
The recipe called for a cup of berries.
Her name is Sarah, and she’s my friend.

back_cards.definition_en: A title of a thing or place
back_cards.example_en: The name of the book is ‘Adventure’.
He made a name for himself in music.
The plant’s scientific name is Rosa.
That store sells name brand clothes.
Physical exercise keeps her healthy.
The store sells physical books, not e-books.
The physical damage to the car was minor.
The experiment tested physical laws.
The job involves physical labor daily.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of increasing in size
back_cards.example_en: The plant’s growth was rapid.
The company saw growth this year.
Traveling contributed to her personal growth.

back_cards.definition_en: An increase in quantity or amount
back_cards.example_en: Population growth is a global issue.
The doctor checked for unusual growth.
The sun rises every morning.

back_cards.definition_en: To increase in value or amount
back_cards.example_en: Prices rise during the holidays.
She rose from her chair to speak.

back_cards.definition_en: To advance in status or rank
back_cards.example_en: He rose to manager in two years.
Tensions rose during the debate.
She waved and said, ‘Hi!’ to her friend.

back_cards.definition_en: An informal way to get attention
back_cards.example_en: Hi, can you help me with this?
Hi, how’s it going today?

back_cards.definition_en: A casual way to acknowledge someone
back_cards.example_en: He shouted, ‘Hi!’ across the street.
Hi, I’ll call you later.

back_cards.definition_en: A level of quality or attainment
back_cards.example_en: The product meets high standards.
The company follows safety standards.
This is the standard for excellence.
The standard was raised during the ceremony.
Double rooms are the standard here.
The storm’s force damaged the trees.

back_cards.definition_en: A group organized for a purpose
back_cards.example_en: The police force patrolled the city.
Her argument had the force of logic.
He opened the door with great force.
The air force conducted a drill.
She signed the contract yesterday.
He signed to his deaf friend.

back_cards.definition_en: To indicate or mark with a symbol
back_cards.example_en: They signed the path with arrows.
He signed up for the marathon.
The team signed a new player.
The room felt cooler with the fan on.
She’s a huge fan of the band.
He’s a fan of classic movies.
The fan helped dry the wet floor.

back_cards.definition_en: A devotee of a sport or activity
back_cards.example_en: Soccer fans cheered loudly.
Her theory about the stars was intriguing.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of principles or ideas
back_cards.example_en: The theory of evolution is widely studied.
His theory on sales increased profits.
The book discusses economic theory.
The detective had a theory about the case.
The staff at the hotel was friendly.

back_cards.definition_en: A stick or pole for support
back_cards.example_en: He leaned on his staff while hiking.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of workers in an organization
back_cards.example_en: The school staff planned the event.
The notes were written on the staff.

back_cards.definition_en: A body of assistants or aides
back_cards.example_en: The mayor’s staff handled the crisis.
She hurt her ankle while running.
His words hurt her feelings.
The storm hurt the crops badly.
My back hurts after lifting boxes.
The scandal hurt his reputation.
She sought legal advice for the case.
It’s legal to park here on weekends.
The contract is a legal document.
The company follows legal standards.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to lawyers or law practice
back_cards.example_en: He joined a legal firm downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: The ninth month of the year
back_cards.example_en: School starts in September.
September brings cooler weather.

back_cards.definition_en: A month for events or holidays
back_cards.example_en: The festival happens every September.
She started her job in September.

back_cards.definition_en: A reference to a specific time
back_cards.example_en: We met in September last year.
